lcInstruction.p: As part of giving a reader an instruction, there may be more than one way to do things. For example, when using an auto stereo system, the user has the choice of which mode to use (AM, FM, CD, line-in, and so on).

To present this information, and to give it a semantically appropriate label, you can use the <choices> or <choicetable> elements. Both present choices: use <choices> when the choices only require a brief description; use <choicetable> when you need to provide more information.
